data.title: If you want a break from the usual "eat out" food, this is the place.
data.text: We were not really sure what to expect with Venezuelan food our first visit (lunch) but found it really good and the Arepna Barn a a great little place. It's family owned and operated, service was excellent with help on navigating the menu and making our dinner selection (second time there). They have a nice range of offerings at what we feel are reasonable prices. For those traveling I-25 through Casper, they are located just a few blocks north on Center Street and the  I-25 Center Street exit. Its well worth the stop.

data.title: OH. EMMMM. GEEEE!!!!!!!
data.text:
So tasty!  Friendliest staff in Casper!  Don't be afraid because you don't know Venezuelan food--the staff will patiently explain!  TRUST this, you won't be disappointed.  The little bowl of chicken broth that is a complimentary appetizer---so flavorful and so fresh. 
The Potato Balls.....yummy, yummy, yummy!!!  
Don't be rushed!!!  I believe the food is cooked to order and very fresh.  Lunch will probably take an hour---so very worth it!  GO, GO, GO!!!!!

data.title: Best Venezuelan Food!
data.text: We have been here several time and had take out too. Their food is delicious! It is gluten free and freshly handmade. It takes a bit to get it but it is worth the wait! The Sunday empanadas are amazing!! The service and cooks are great!

data.title: Clean, friendly atmosphere & great food!
data.text: Passing through Casper Wyoming on a recent road trip, we searched the internet for restaurants and found The Arepa Barn! They have been open for about 4 months and you can feel the measure of pride and hard work that has gone into this restaurant. So glad we tried them! The owner, Vern, seated us himself. He was happy to explain the menu items to us and offer recommendations. Your food is prepared fresh and really did not take too long to arrive at our table. This is authentic Venezuelan cuisine and very tasty! Fried plantains are a side option with your order. Your meal starts out with a bowl of flavorful soup and an order of mini Arepas with dipping sauces. When you receive your meal you may think it is not much food but trust me, it is incredibly delicious and quite filling! The beverage called Papelon con limon (pure sugarcane juice and lemon) is also quite refreshing and tasty. We were absolutely pleased with our meal and the friendly service at The Arepa Barn and wish Vern and his wife Alejandra much success!

data.title: Owner is very friendly
data.text: This is a gluten free restaurant serving venezuelan food. I went with a friend who loves it. I wasn't very impressed. The menu is not written in a way that made much sense to someone lacking in Venezualan terminology. It was in English, but I was left not really knowing what to order, so I went with the special, which was something Negro. Every question I had asked the server was answered with "I don't know" or "I'm not sure." The meal came with a saucer with 8 little arepas (fried corn cakes about the size of a quarter). They were actually very tasty once I salted them, but if you want more it's another $2 for 8 quarter sized bland corn cakes. The meal also came with soup. There was about a quarter cup of soup that was 90% watery broth and 10% onions, mystery meat, and celery. At this point, I was thinking Venezualan food is just plan bland! My meal came and smelled very fragrant - there were two thin slices of marinated meat about the size of a playing card, an ice cream scoop of white rice, and a small pile of steamed vegetables that had the white on them that looks like they are dried out. My first bite of meat was cold. Not room temperature, cold like it just came out of the refrigerator. I asked my friend if it was supposed to be cold and she said no. We called the waitress over and she took it back and heated it, when she brought it back there was a long black hair on top of the scoop of rice. The meat had an excellent flavor, but was very dry. The rice was unflavored, as were the vegetables. It came with a fried plantain, which I had never tried before. It was the most flavorful part of the meal. The owner came over and spoke to us and apologized and offered a free meal, which I declined saying I was no longer hungry. He came back twice, insisting on giving me a free something to make up for it. I finally said ok and he gave me a sandwich that he said was the most popular item on the menu. I sent it with my SO in his lunch and he did not care for it at all. If you are gluten free, the entire restaurant is safe. I won't go back, because I don't like bland food or small portions for an expensive meal ($12+). If you like Venezuelan food, give it a try! I was assured by my friend and the owner that the service is usually better and they have never before been served cold food or food with hair in it. I am giving it three stars because of the owner....and because my friend says it wasn't a normal experience here - otherwise I would give it 1 star.

data.title: An arupa South American restaurant in WY? Yes!
data.text: Who would expect to find an arupa/Venezualean restauatnt in casper, WY? We chose to eat there for that very unique reason. And the place has an interesting story. The owner is a South American gentleman who used to work in the oil business in Casper, but wanted to do something else, so he brought up his family and opened the restaurant and it is very much a mom and pop place. The arupas were good, the menu varied, and he is very proud of offering gluten free selections. The banana shake was outstanding..

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Great food and service at reasonable price. Very delicious deserts. I'll definitely be back to try other items on the menu.

data.title: Excellent Food and Customer Service
data.text: The Owner came up and spoke to us. He was so friendly and accommodating. The food was excellent and customer service was exceptional. I will be returning to eat here again!

data.title: Great Food, Friendly Atmostphere
data.text:
The owner came out to our table, to share the story about how the restaurant got started.  Our server was super polite, and very attentive.  I would say that the service overall was really good.  The food itself was hot and fresh, and very tasty. We even had desert, I would recommend the pineapple cake!
We will definitely return!

data.title: Arepas were wonderful.
data.text: My second visit in a week. Had the shreded chicken and avacado arepa. Looks small but was very filling. The ingredients were fresh and service solid. Very clean and comfortable.

data.title: Tasty and filling!
data.text: The arepas are very tasty and filling. They look small, but with loads of fillings they're very satisfying. Since everything is gluten free anyone could find a choice that they could eat. The service was okay, but the food was worth the wait.
